lines.text: Aren't you coming up?
Directly, dear. I see Andrews hovering over the Scotch and I wouldn't want to disappoint him. Will you have a spot before you turn in?
No thank you. Hurry won't you?
But I thought you didn't want to go to bed.
John, you just *won't* understand.
It's funny the evolution of marriage. First, a double bed, then twin beds, now separate rooms.
One never does know, does one, about one's best friend.
I love her as a husband loves his wife, and you as a man loves a woman.
Well, I've had a lot of shotgun weddings, but this is the first fire ax wedding I've ever officiated at.
Is this a private fight or can anyone join in?
When a woman as nice like yourself, comes to see a Detective like me it's because her husband's up to no good. What's the scamper doing? Sending you flowers, I suppose?
Why, yes, he has.
Just as I thought. When flowers comes in the door, love flies out the window.
Now, what's your husband's name?
John.
Oh, John, oh, the scamp. The same name as mine.
Miki, think of it! She succumbed!
Yes sir! Shall I prepare for your bath?
Immediately!
Oh, we're just putty in the hands of fate. Love is a remarkable thing. It just must have its way!
Faster, please. You know, Carol, you're so impetuous! I never realized it. You always seemed so cold and so reserved.
Oh, Eric is so impetuous! Sit here, Eric, now. I think this is too lovely!
But, I think that's too daring for words! I'd like to try one.
Oh, Carol!
Yes, Eric, just one. Do give me one, Charlotte.
Well, I, eh, I just used up the last box, I'm sorry.
I'm glad of that. I do not approve of women smoking cigars.
Eric is so old fashioned - about some things. Ha-ha. Well, I suppose I've got to go back to plain, everyday, cigarettes.
Now, this is exactly what we want. A perfect love nest.
Oh, quite. Quite.
Interesting bed, isn't it?
Can anybody hear us?
Of course not! Why do you ask?
Charlotte, I've got to frank with you. There's a man in this room, isn't there?
A man! Where?
Well, goodbye Charlotte. Let the poor Colonel out of the closet.
It may not have happened yet. I'm going home. I'm going to nip this Eric business in the bud before it goes any further.
Say, I've got to get out of here and think this thing over and plan a campaign.
Well, can't you plan it here?
He'll be fit to be canned when I finish with him along with his smelly sardines.
Oh, now John, calm yourself, darling.
Calm myself, knowing that my wife may have been unfaithful to me? The only woman I ever loved!
Well, what about me?
Wiggle that around, will you? Please?
Carol, you have a lovely back.
We find new wonders every day.
And this beauty spot is most intriguing!
Since when has that mole become a beauty spot?
But they never quarrel. Never! They were snapping at each other like turtles.
Paul, you wait here. I'm going up and have a hen-to-hen talk with mother.
I just meant it wouldn't be so hard on her if you married me.
I apologize in advance for what I'm about to say; but, for heaven's sake - will you shut up!
Oh, its so good of you to help me.
Why, just to be near you, my princess, is exciting.
Yes, now, run along, there's a good boy. Will you Eric? I'm tired. I-I wanted to lie down.
Oh, well, can't I stay just a little while?
Of course not. I'm going to undress.
What is it darling?
Paul and I are going to live together.
Quite right, darling. Young people should. When do you intend to marry?
We're not going to marry.
Who's there?
It's your father, Janet. Open the door. Janet, do you hear me? Open this door!
Paul says no, father. You see, we're in bed!
Will you promise to get married immediately?
Oh, as soon as we can get some clothes on, Mother.
It's those crazy youngsters, Paul and Janet, they're in that room in bed and they're not married!
What?
How enterprising of them.
If immorality is enterprising, you're a pioneer!
Well, then, this is all your fault!
Say, you keep your nose out of my affairs!
Affairs describes it perfectly!
Why, Charlotte, would it surprise you to know that the female sardine, in breeding, spawns between four and five million eggs.
How exciting!
